ETYMOLOGY: From Old French injustice, from Latin iniustitia ('injustice'), from iniustus ('unjust'), from in- ('not') + iustus ('just').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. [U] means 'uncountable noun'.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Lack of fairness or justice; the state of being unjust.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The legal system sometimes allows for serious injustice to occur.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 法律体系有时会允许严重的不公发生。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these. [C] means 'countable noun'.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An unfair act or a particular instance of unfair treatment.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不公正的行为；委屈；不公之事
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He felt that his dismissal from the job was a great injustice.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他觉得自己被解雇是极大的不公。

REGISTER: Formal or serious contexts when discussing societal issues, law, or personal grievances.
